From the perspective of the actor’s suffering body Jody Enders’s The Medieval Theatre of Cruelty: Rhetoric, Memory, Violence is very relevant. She expands on the social, juridical, and rhetorical sources and uses of violence and torture in the theatre as manifestations of sheerly bodily inf lictions of pain and punishment that were part of society’s disciplinary norms and agenda
